revised_title: Crystal Structure and Properties of Tartaric Acid
tldr: This article explores the crystal structure and properties of tartaric acid, focusing on its molecular structure and the positions of its molecules in the unit cell. The authors use X-ray diffraction and crystallography to study the crystal lattice and discuss the implications of the tartaric acid's unique properties, such as its optical activity and the presence of a unique dyad axis of symmetry.
